unit_learning_outcomes.description: Communicate effectively on operations management issues and challenges.
Analyse and explain the role of operations management in a contemporary global setting.
Analyse and solve operations management problems, both individually and collaboratively.
Demonstrate a critical understanding of operations management both in theory and in practice.

enrolment_rules.description: 150cp at 1000 level or above including (HRM317 or MGMT3017) and (BBA350 or MGMT3050)

data.description: Operations management is about designing international processes and continually improving them to contribute to an organisation's success and competitiveness. This unit provides an introductory understanding of operations management and covers substantial modules, including directing the operation, designing the operation, as well as delivery and development. Students will learn key operational business practices and apply theory and technique to real examples drawn from business cases. Contemporary issues in operations management are also explored. By the end of this unit, students are able to develop and consolidate the skills of communication and problem solving in operations management.
